bibl.title: Aspects of the Diffusion of Ptolemaic Portraiture Overseas.
The Ptolemies, the Sea and the Nile. Studies in Waterborne Power.

bibl.note: Ptolemaic royal portraits were manufactured in Alexandria and shipped on demand to Ptolemaic territories or allied cities, as shown here for those found within the borders of modern Greece. Their diffusion reflects the power and influence of the Ptolemaic empire in the third century and first half of the second century.
bibl.seg: Olga Palagia, Aspects of the Diffusion of Ptolemaic Portraiture Overseas.
Kostas Buraselis, Mary Stefanou & Dorothy J. Thompson (edd.), The Ptolemies, the Sea and the Nile. Studies in Waterborne Power (Cambridge, 2013) pp. 143-159, 10 figg.

Ptolemaic royal portraits were manufactured in Alexandria and shipped on demand to Ptolemaic territories or allied cities, as shown here for those found within the borders of modern Greece. Their diffusion reflects the power and influence of the Ptolemaic empire in the third century and first half of the second century.
